summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between U.S. Attorney's Office staff regarding the notification of victims about a status hearing in the case of United States v. Jeffrey Epstein. The chain discusses technical issues with the Victim Notification System (VNS) template and reveals that the FBI had identified four additional victims who needed to be notified.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the case United States v. Epstein. The emails are about notifying victims of a status hearing in his case.

events.title: Approval to Notify Additional Victims
events.description: A senior official approves sending out status hearing notifications and specifically approves adding and notifying four additional victims identified by the FBI.

events.title: VNS Notification Template Discussion
events.description: Email exchange discussing difficulties editing the Victim Notification System (VNS) template for the Epstein case status hearing letters, including requests to modify case caption language and hearing information.

locations.context: Address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), from which the Victim-Witness Assistant is corresponding.

keyFacts: The FBI had identified four additional victims in the Jeffrey Epstein case as of August 5, 2019, who needed to be notified of a status hearing.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY was using a Victim Notification System (VNS) with a rigid template that was difficult to edit for case-specific details.
The correspondence shows internal procedural coordination within the prosecutor's office regarding victim communications in an active, high-profile case.
